citation.article-title: Description of Paenisporosarcina quisquiliarum gen. nov., sp. nov., and reclassification of Sporosarcina macmurdoensis Reddy et al. 2003 as Paenisporosarcina macmurdoensis comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenisporosarcina macmurdoensis comb. nov.
Paenisporosarcina macmurdoensis (mac.mur.do.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. macmurdoensis pertaining to the McMurdo Region, Antarctica, where the first isolates were collected).
Basonym: Sporosarcina macmurdoensis Reddy et al. 2003.
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description above.
The description of the phenotypic properties is the same as that given by Reddy et al. (2003) except for the following characteristics.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 1ω7c alcohol.

Fatty acids occurring in minor amounts are iso-C14 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, summed feature 4 (iso-C17 : 1 I and/or anteiso-C17 : 1 B), anteiso-C17 : 0, C16 : 1ω11c, C16 : 0, iso-C17 : 1ω10c, C14 : 0 and C15 : 0 (Table 1).
It should be noted that the major fatty acids might also include the components reported by Reddy et al. (2003) if different culture conditions are used.
The polar lipid profile consists of the lipids listed in the genus description plus three phospholipids (PL2, 4 and 5) and two unknown lipids (UL2 and 5).
